definition: to take advantage of weakness
four horse military chariot (archaic)/four (archaic)/generic term for history books
to ride/to mount/to make use of/to avail oneself of/to take advantage of/to multiply (math.)/Buddhist sect or creed
surname Cheng
old variant of 乘[cheng2]
emptiness/void/abstract theory or guiding principles/empty or unoccupied/diffident or timid/false/humble or modest/(of health) weak/virtual/in vain
to enter by exploiting a weak spot (idiom); to take advantage of a lapse

sentences.english: Don't exhaust yourself or minor health problems will set in.
sentences.chinese: 不要让自己太疲惫，否则健康问题会乘虚而入的。

sentences.english: This in turn will take advantage of the extreme forces of convenience.
sentences.chinese: 这又会给极端势力乘虚而入带来便利。

sentences.english: Praise shames me, for I secretly beg for it.
sentences.chinese: 荣耀使我感到羞愧，因为我的虚荣打算乘虚作乱。

sentences.english: Typhoid fever sneaks in when sanitation fails.
sentences.chinese: 环境卫生搞不好，伤寒就会乘虚而入。

sentences.english: One day Jiang Wei led his soldiers to seize army provisions. The soldiers of the Shu State took advantage of this and seized the city.
sentences.chinese: 一日带兵劫粮，蜀兵乘虚取冀城。

sentences.english: Seniors swoop in as young chicks enter their first year in college.
sentences.chinese: 小妞们刚开始大学第一年的生活，学长们就乘虚而入。

definition: to enter by exploiting a weak spot (idiom); to take advantage of a lapse
to seize an opportunity/to exploit (a loophole)
pathogenic influence (TCM)
to seize the opportunity/to strike while the iron is hot
to follow up a victory/to pursue retreating enemy
to take the opportunity/to take a plane
to take advantage of a favorable situation/to seize an opportunity
to intercept/to waylay/to ambush
to march straight in unchallenged (military) (idiom)/(fig.) to push deep into the heart of sth/to flood in
to coordinate outside and inside offensives (idiom)/(fig.) to act together
to neglect to take precautions/relaxed vigilance
raid/to carry out a raid/to invade
to attack jointly
to impede/to hold sb back
to attack and seize
inappropriate/improper
